channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: PNP chief wants death for 50g of shabu
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa said yesterday that the death penalty should be reimposed on convicted drug dealers nabbed in possession of at least 50 grams.

item.title: Gyms, internet shops to reopen on August 1
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: More businesses such as review centers, gyms, internet shops, aesthetic establishments and drive-in cinemas will be allowed to reopen in areas under general community quarantine starting Aug. 1, following approval given by the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases, the Department of Trade and Industry said.

item.title: Audit of COVID-19 -related spending sought
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Senators urged the Commission on Audit to conduct a special audit on all government spending related to the response to the coronavirus disease pandemic under the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act (Republic Act 11469) or Bayanihan 1.

item.title: SolGen, BSP chief among highest paid government execs
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: Solicitor General Jose Calida and Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas Governor Benjamin Diokno were among the highest paid government officials in 2019, according to the latest report by the Commission on Audit.

item.title: Philippines deadliest country for environmental defenders in Asia
item.author: Louise Maureen Simeon
item.description: The Philippines remains a hotspot for environmental defenders, with the country listed as the deadliest in Asia and second in the world after it recorded 43 killings last year.

item.title: Don’t block defense of West Philippine Sea, government urged
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The Philippines’ former top diplomat urged the government yesterday not to stand in the way of Filipinos legitimately protecting the country’s territory.

item.title: BSP releases new banknotes
item.author: Lawrence Agcaoili
item.description: The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas has launched enhanced new generation currency banknotes with tactile marks to help the elderly and visually impaired as well as featuring the latest anti-counterfeiting technology.

item.title: DepEd hits 22.2 million enrollment target
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education has reached its enrollment target of 22.2 million students for the upcoming school year, a 20-percent drop from the student population last year.c

item.title: House panel wants 12% VAT on Netflix
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House ways and means committee yesterday approved a bill seeking to impose value-added tax (VAT) on popular digital streaming service Netflix and other major digital service providers to generate revenues to combat the coronavirus disease pandemic.

item.title: Gapay named AFP chief
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: Army commander Lt. Gen. Gilbert Gapay will be the next chief of the Armed Forces of the Philippines.
